title: Ovid Fasti 4 - how they feel about the work

content.description:
Directions: Read the following selection carefully for comprehension. The selection is followed by a number of related questions and incomplete statements. Select the best answer or completion.

Ovid describes the lovely meadow where Prosegina goes with her companions.

Filia1 consuetis ut erat comitata puellis,

errabat nudo per sua prata pede.

Valle sub umbrosa locus est aspergine2 multa

uvidus ex alto desilientis aquae.

(5) Tot fuerant illic, quot habet natura, colores,

pictaque dissimili ﬂore nitebat3 humus.4

Quam simul aspexit, “Comites, accedite,” dixit

“et mecum plenos ﬂore referte sinus."5

Praeda puellares animos prolectat6 inanis,

(10) et non sentitur sedulitate7 labor.

Haec implet lento calathos8 e vimine9 nexos,

haec gremium, laxos10 degravat illa sinus.

1 filia = Proserpina

2 aspergo, -inis, f.: sprinkling

3 niteo, -ere: shine

4 humus, -i, f.: ground

5 sinus, -us, m.: folds of a garment, perhaps the aprons of the dresses

6 prolecto, -are: entice, allure

7 sedulitas, -atis, f.: earnestness

8 calathus, -i, m.: handbasket

9 vimen, -inis, n.: pliant twig

10 laxus, -a, -um, adj.: loose
content.question: From the words et non sentitur sedulitate labor (line 10), we learn that

choices.label: they are too busy to feel fatigue
they do not pay attention to their work
she does not feel anxious about the work

content.answer: they are too busy to feel fatigue
